data.title: Fixes potential crash in AudioEngine::uncache(filePath).
cocos commandline failed if iOS project has xcworkspace (because of pod)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.11.1
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1 (7D1014)

I have added pods to my project, so the project is moved from xcodeproj to xcworkspace. But after that, I can't compile the iOS project with the command "cocos compile -p ios", because it failed to find the pod library.

data.title: Avoid unnecessary allocation if targetGrid is reusable
data.body:
This PR reduces unnecessary GridBase allocation in `GridAction::startWithTarget()`.

`GridAction::startWithTarget()` calls `this->getGrid()`, which results in a GridBase allocation such as `Grid3DAction::getGrid()` or `TiledGrid3DAction::getGrid`. If `targetGrid->getReuseGrid() > 0` is true, `targetGrid` is reusable, then these allocations can be avoided.

Thanks!

data.body: fixes github issue #14711

data.title: RichText improvements
data.body:
- Added BM Font support for text elements
- Added Sprite frame support for image elements
- Added means to align RichText elements on their baseline
  - Added means to obtain the ascent (used as baseline offset) for BM Font, TTF and system font (on Windows, Linux, and Android only for now; through Texture2D)

RichText::setAlignToBaseline supports 3 values:
- ALL: align all elements on the text baseline (default on Android, Windows and Linux).
- TEXT: align only text element on their baseline, the images positioned on the bottom.
- NONE: no baseline alignment, all elements are positioned on the bottom (same as before, default for all other platforms).

To work correctly on Linux with system fonts it needs the fix from: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16328

Here are screenshots to show the different alignments:
- before the changes:
  ![alignonbaseline_before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17497871/08048c6c-5d92-11e6-8081-d0f2d3934e26.png)
- NONE (as we can see, it gives the same result as before):
  ![alignonbaseline_none](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17497885/16b99112-5d92-11e6-82c5-fa1dd52def38.png)
- TEXT:
  ![alignonbaseline_text](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17497890/1ca7a636-5d92-11e6-9b41-1ac852991610.png)
- ALL:
  ![alignonbaseline_all](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17497901/209174fc-5d92-11e6-970d-6241b3864dc1.png)

data.title: Win10: disabled /ZW option for .c files for all platforms/configurations
data.body: This PR removes the /ZW option from all .c files in Win10 libSpline project for all build configurations. Recent updates to spline broke the Win10 build.

data.title: V3.13 remove the /ZW option from all .c files in Win10 libSpline
data.body: This PR removes the /ZW option from all .c files in Win10 libSpline project for all build configurations. Recent updates to spline broke the Win10 build.

data.title: There is no OpenGL ES extensions called GL_IMG_texture_format_BGRA8888
data.body: There are extensions GL_EXT_texture_format_BGRA8888 and GL_APPLE_texture_format_BGRA8888.

data.title: Ease Actions Code De-Duplication w/MACROs
data.body:
This follows the discussion around the PR by JAKZ to use templates to reduce code of ease actions.

My original PR with only slight modifications to fix build issues with JAKZ PR.
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16159

Use MACROs instead of templates in order to allow for ease of binding generation without requiring updates to LLVM and the bindings-generator repo.

While I did test out adding support for templates to the binding generator using LLVM 3.5+ and ignoring the direct template classes in Lua I felt that an improved action/ease/rate/tween system for v4 would be better use of time. 

If people dislike MACROs for this use case just close this one as well.

The goal here would be to simplify changes to the ease actions as well as allow easy generation of new ones for 3.13+. Since this code changes infrequently it may be overkill.

This PR was not too much work to convert the templates to MACROs so I figured I might as well submit it.

data.title: IOSMP33.12
Remove AppDelegate memory leak in Android projects
data.body:
AppDelegate object and all its members are never released.
As a solution, I proposed to use static `unique_ptr` that could destroy it at the end of the application.

Before applying the aforementioned fix I corrected also code style and correctness of `main.cpp` files in Android projects:
- removed unused includes (reducing dependencies and compilation time)
- removed unused code
- corrected code style (whitespaces, headers' order, etc).

data.body: I modified the size of visibleTiles in order to draw layer properly if contentScaleFactor is not 1.

data.title: fix: TriangleCommands with custom uniforms can be batched
data.body:
TriangleCommands with custom uniforms can be batched together.

This improves the performance when using custom uniforms without
adding any penalties when not using them

Github issue #16224

data.title: Fix size/position calculations for Linux system fonts.
data.body:
Here are screenshots from cpp-tests before and after the change on Linux, and the same screenshots on Windows for comparison.
- RichText XMLSmallBig test before than changes:
  The line height was incorrect (too big) and the horizontal spacing was too small ("normal" was stuck to the dot after "bigger").
  ![xmlsmallbig_before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452117/4e4412ce-5b3a-11e6-9b7f-77ac59a98585.png)
- after the changes:
  ![xmlsmallbig_after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452137/6bd2be4e-5b3a-11e6-94b9-86bd93c52c1d.png)
- on Windows:
  ![xmlsmallbig_windows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452140/7436b446-5b3a-11e6-9c19-22f4e945d868.png)
- XMLFace test before the changes:
  The line height was incorrect (too big).
  ![xmlface_before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452142/7e702190-5b3a-11e6-9383-6e263e72f012.png)
- after the changes:
  ![xmlface_after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452143/83652984-5b3a-11e6-872c-81b1cae4fcea.png)
- on Windows:
  ![xmlface_windows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11037060/17452145/887eead6-5b3a-11e6-88ea-584198419117.png)

data.title: Large Memory Leaks on iOS-JS due to Spidermonkey
*Fix: GLThread and other threads access sDownloaderMap in a thread-un
data.body: GLThread and other threads(`js_load_remote_image` creates CCDownloader in another thread) access `sDownloaderMap` in a thread-unsafe way, which will result in crash in some occasion on Android.

data.title: Scheduler may crash
Cameras don't work anymore.
data.body:
I pulled the latest cocos2dx from github(v3.13).

I'm not sure what the problem is. Either the all cameras stopped working or the function
sprite->setCameraMask()  doesnt do anything anymore.

here is my game running on v3.12
https://www.dropbox.com/s/f5c21h05uhc53b4/forMusic.mp4?dl=0

running on v3.13
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8nglvua4mxrhl1x/cameraBug.mov?dl=0

cameras dont seem to follow the player any more... same with the backgrounds.
This has the same effect when i remove all the cameras.

I know i should only use the released version. But i had to do some tests for @dumganhar on android phones

if you need more tests please let me know.

Thanks
